xxl.core.relational.resultSets
Class ResultSets

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.relational.resultSets.ResultSets

public class ResultSets
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains various useful static methods for managing columns of result sets.

Most of these methods are used internally by the join operation of this package.

This class cannot become instantiated.

Method Detail

getColumnIndices

public static int[] getColumnIndices(java.sql.ResultSet resultSet,
                                     java.lang.String... columnNames)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
Transfers an array of column names into an array of indices. For every column, the method findColumn from the class ResultSet is called exactly once.

This method is identical to ResultSetMetaDatas.getColumnIndices(resultSet.getMetaData(), columnNames) (except exception handling if getMetaData() itself throws an exception).

Parameters:
resultSet - the result set that is used.
columnNames - an array of strings that contains the names of some of the result set's columns.
Returns:
an array of int values containing the indices of the given columns.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

getColumnNames

public static java.lang.String[] getColumnNames(java.sql.ResultSet resultSet,
                                                int... columnIndices)
                                         throws java.sql.SQLException
Transfers an array of indices into an array of column names. To get the column names, this method uses the metadata of the result set.

Parameters:
resultSet - the result set that is used.
columnIndices - an array of int values that contains the indices of some of the result set's columns.
Returns:
an array of string objects containing the names of the given columns.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

getCreateTableQuery

public static java.lang.String getCreateTableQuery(java.lang.String tableName,
                                                   java.sql.ResultSetMetaData rsmd,
                                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> typeMap)
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
Creates a SQL query string for the creation of a table with the given name and the schema given as a result set's metadata object.

Parameters:
tableName - the name of the table to be created.
rsmd - the schema of the new table.
typeMap - a map which maps the type names to type names which are understood by a specific database system.
Returns:
the query string.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

getCreateTableQuery

public static java.lang.String getCreateTableQuery(java.lang.String tableName,
                                                   java.sql.ResultSetMetaData rsmd)
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
Creates a SQL query string for the creation of a table with the given name and the schema given as a result set's metadata object. The standard type names are used.

Parameters:
tableName - the name of the table to be created.
rsmd - the schema of the new table.
Returns:
the query string.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

getPreparedInsertStatement

public static java.sql.PreparedStatement getPreparedInsertStatement(java.sql.Connection con,
                                                                    java.lang.String tableName,
                                                                    java.sql.ResultSetMetaData rsmd)
                                                             throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns a prepared statement which is used to insert data of a given schema into a database.

Parameters:
con - the connection to the database.
tableName - the name of the table where the data is inserted.
rsmd - the relational schema of the table of the database.
Returns:
the prepared statement which can be used for insertion.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

insertIntoTable

public static void insertIntoTable(MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<? super java.lang.String,? super java.sql.ResultSetMetaData>> mdc,
                                   java.sql.Connection con,
                                   java.lang.String tableName)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
Inserts a complete MetaDataCursor (which provides at least relational metadata) into a table inside a database. Inside this method, a prepared statement is used.

Parameters:
mdc - the input data which will be written into the database.
con - the connection to the database.
tableName - the name of the table where the data is inserted.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

getMapFunctionTupleToInsertQuery

public static Function<Tuple,java.lang.String> getMapFunctionTupleToInsertQuery(java.lang.String tableName)
Returns a function which transforms a tuple (the only parameter with which the function has to be called) into a SQL insert query string.

Parameters:
tableName - the name of the table into which the tuple should be inserted.
Returns:
the conversion function.

createTable

public static boolean createTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                                  java.sql.ResultSetMetaData rsmd,
                                  java.sql.Connection con,
                                  java.io.PrintStream sqlLog,
                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> typeMap)
Creates a table in a database which is compatible with the given schema.

Parameters:
tableName - the name of the table to be created.
rsmd - the schema of the new table.
con - the connection to the database.
sqlLog - a print stream to which SQL query strings are written.
typeMap - a map which maps the type names to type names which are understood by a specific database system.
Returns:
true iff the table was created successfully.

createTable

public static boolean createTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                                  java.sql.ResultSetMetaData rsmd,
                                  java.sql.Connection con,
                                  java.io.PrintStream sqlLog)
Creates a table in a database which is compatible with the given schema. The standard type names are used.

Parameters:
tableName - the name of the table to be created.
rsmd - the schema of the new table.
con - the connection to the database.
sqlLog - a print stream to which SQL query strings are written.
Returns:
true iff the table was created successfully.

insertIntoTable

public static int insertIntoTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                                  MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,?> mdc,
                                  java.sql.Connection con,
                                  java.io.PrintStream sqlLog)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
Inserts the tuples of a given metadata cursor into a table of a database. For each tuple, a new insert query is created. This method does not use prepared statements.

Parameters:
tableName - the name of the table where the tuples are inserted.
mdc - the metadata cursor which contains the tuples to be inserted.
con - the connection to the database.
sqlLog - a print stream to which SQL query strings are written.
Returns:
the number of tuples inserted into the database.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

writeToPrintStream

public static void writeToPrintStream(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,? extends CompositeMetaData<? super java.lang.String,? super java.sql.ResultSetMetaData>> mdc,
                                      java.io.PrintStream ps,
                                      boolean writeHeadline,
                                      java.lang.String separator)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
Writes the metadata cursor to a print stream. Each tuple is separated with a given String (use "\t" for tab separation). To be compatible with GnuPlot, use for example: writeToPrintStream(mdc, new PrintStream(new FileOutputStream("test.plt")), false, "\t");

Parameters:
mdc - the metadata cursor which is processed.
ps - a print stream where the output is sent.
writeHeadline - when it is specified by true a line with the column names will be written at first.
separator - the separator which separates a column of a tuple from the next column (also used for the column names if writeHeadline is true).
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
